page.lettertext:
Belgia 1589 27 March
M
r
Bodleigh
S
r
. This gen
t
Monsieur Caron
the bearer hereof having
occasion to returne into those Contries about his owne private
affa ires, is put in trust by her
Ma
tie
upon a good conceipt
she hath of this honestie and sufficiencie, and report of his creditt
with the Countes and
States,
to use all good offices of frend-
shipp between her H
s
and them, as also to mediate some good,
for
Deventer
and others in his case as your self heretofore
have had also direction. And for that my self also thinck
him a gen
t
of good parts and gyfts, and likely to doe
some
good
in those matters towardes the said States I pray
you acquaint him howe farre you have alreadie proceeded,
that he may with
e more speed effect
e same, as also
that you would use him with all curtesie and favo
r
in anie
thing wherein you may stand him in steed.
And so I
co
m
end me hartely unto you. From my howse in Se-
thing Lane this xxvij
th
of March
1589
.
Yo
r
verie Loving frende. Francis Walsingham
